legal.title: Quantum Nexus © 2026
legal.subtitle: Strategic Network Building Game
legal.languageNotice: Official legal text is in English. Translations are for convenience only.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: These Terms govern your use of Quantum Nexus. By using the game, you agree to these Terms.

sections.licenseBody: You are granted a personal, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to use the game for personal, non-commercial entertainment.
sections.acceptableBody: Do not hack, reverse engineer, or attempt to interfere with the game. Do not use automation, exploits, or unauthorized tools.
sections.contentBody: Quantum Nexus does not accept user-generated content at this time.
sections.liabilityBody: The game is provided "as is" without warranties. To the maximum extent permitted by law, we are not liable for damages arising from use of the game.
sections.changesBody: We may update these Terms from time to time. Continued use after updates indicates acceptance.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Quantum Nexus is an offline-only game. We do not collect or share personal data.

sections.dataBody: No accounts, analytics, ads, or crash reporting are used. We do not collect identifiers or usage data.
sections.permissionsBody: The app does not request device permissions beyond standard platform requirements.
sections.storageBody: Game progress is stored locally on your device. Uninstalling the app removes local data.
sections.childrenBody: We do not knowingly collect personal data from children because we do not collect any data.
sections.changesBody: If this policy changes, we will update the date shown here.

lobby.title: Lobby
lobby.subtitle: Waiting for players
lobby.waitingHost: Waiting for the lobby host to start.
lobby.waitingReady: The host will start the match once all players are ready.

categoryDescriptions.research: Research nodes provide special abilities and efficiency boosts.
categoryDescriptions.production: Production nodes offer high efficiency with greater costs.
categoryDescriptions.network: Network nodes are complex, high-value additions to your system.
categoryDescriptions.control: Control nodes provide utility effects and flexibility.

effects.discount: Reduces {{target}} costs by {{value}} when building nodes
effects.draw: Allows viewing {{value}} additional node(s) from deck
effects.swap: Enables swapping up to {{value}} energy types

alerts.discardRequiredMessage: Discard {{count}} energy before taking another action.
alerts.insufficientEnergyMessage: Not enough energy to build this node.
alerts.noFluxMessage: Flux is required to reserve a node.
alerts.unavailableMessage: This node is reserved by another player.
alerts.exchangeInvalid: Cannot complete this exchange with current pool or energy.

exchange.title: Exchange Energy
exchange.subtitle: Choose 1:1 or 2:3 exchange. Flux cannot be exchanged.

swap.title: Swap Energy
swap.subtitle: Select up to {{count}} energy to give and take.

draw.title: Draw Nodes
draw.subtitle: Select one node to inject into the market.

tutorial.welcomeBody1: Build a quantum computing network by collecting energy and constructing nodes.
tutorial.welcomeBody2: Be the first to achieve victory through efficiency, network size, or protocol mastery.
tutorial.energyTypesBody: There are 4 energy types plus Flux:
tutorial.yourTurnBody: On your turn, choose ONE action:
tutorial.collectLine2: • Take 2 of the same type (if 4+ available)
tutorial.exchangeLine4: • Pool must have energy to take
tutorial.nodesBody: Nodes are the core of your network. Each provides:
tutorial.outputBody: Each node generates 1 output of its type, which counts toward Protocol requirements and reduces that energy cost by 1 when building nodes (base energies only).
tutorial.protocolsBody: Protocols are powerful upgrades you can claim:
tutorial.protocolRequirementsLine1: Must have enough OUTPUT generation (not energy held)
tutorial.protocolRequirementsLine2: Outputs are not spent and can qualify for multiple Protocols
tutorial.protocolClaimingLine1: Must actively tap to claim (not automatic)
tutorial.protocolBenefitsLine1: Provides efficiency points + ongoing special effects
tutorial.protocolExamples: Examples: Double output generation, free reserves, energy swaps, cost reductions
tutorial.strategyMultipleBody: Focus on efficiency, network size, or protocol mastery - or mix strategies.
tutorial.strategyFluxBody: Use as wild energy, but limited supply. Reserve to gain Flux.
tutorial.strategyEffectsBody: Effects are temporary and trigger after building nodes.
tutorial.strategyTimingBody: Efficiency threshold only triggers after turn 20 - plan accordingly.
